== KDE System Settings ==

Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.  

You might find it more convenient to edit the wiki page using <code>editmoin</code> a command line utility for editing moinmoin wiki pages.  It is available as a package in Gutsy and Hardy.  More information including an easier way to do this was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-bugsquad/2007-November/000666.html|mailed]]</nowiki> to the Bug Squad.

Some information on what to do can be found at <nowiki>[[DebuggingKDE]]</nowiki>.  Note that "kde-systemsettings" is just the shell Kubuntu uses to access the various settings modules.  Often bugs should be filed against a different package such as kdebase or kde-guidance.  Namely, the displayconfig, userconfig, serviceconfig, mountconfig, and wineconfig modules are part of kde-guidance and should be filed and <nowiki>[[DebuggingKDE#head-c6ec343c93857af9e515b2beeba99892190bb115|tagged]]</nowiki> appropriately.

=== 50 bugs in New state ===
These are untriaged or not confirmed KDE System Settings bugs and bugs for some KDE-Guidance settings modules.  The displayconfig module is intentionally not included as it merits its own bug day.  Note that many settings modules are in kdebase, and those aren't listed here (feel free to add them on).

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
*** Ask for more details, change the bug's status to "Incomplete" and subscribe yourself or
*** Try to recreate the bug in Hardy, document the test case in the description and change the bug's status to "Confirmed".
